title: Sum of Two Integers
description:
Sum of Two Integers

Given two integers a and b, return the sum of the two integers without using the operators + and -.

Examples:

  • Input: a = 1, b = 2
    Output: 3
  • Input: a = 2, b = 3
    Output: 5

Constraints:

  • -1000 <= a, b <= 1000
solution_text:
Sum of Two Integers

Algorithm:

  1. Use XOR to calculate sum without carry: a XOR b
  2. Use AND and left shift to calculate carry: (a AND b) << 1
  3. Repeat until there is no carry (carry becomes 0)
  4. Handle negative numbers using mask for 32-bit integers
  5. Convert back from 32-bit representation if needed

Time Complexity: O(1) - at most 32 iterations for 32-bit integers

Space Complexity: O(1) - constant extra space

Key Insights:

  • XOR gives sum without considering carry
  • AND gives positions where carry occurs, left shift by 1 to add carry to next position
  • Repeat until no more carry bits remain
  • Python needs special handling for negative numbers due to arbitrary precision integers
